meanings.definition: The action or practice of deceiving someone by concealing or misrepresenting the truth.
meanings.sent1: His deceits were uncovered when the truth came out.
meanings.sent2: The deceits of the con artist fooled many people.
meanings.sent3: The magician's deceits left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The deceits of the spy were like a tangled web.
meanings.sent5: The deceits in the mystery novel kept readers guessing.

meanings.definition: The quality of being deceitful; dishonesty.
meanings.sent1: She was known for her deceits among her friends.
meanings.sent2: The deceits of the politician were finally exposed.
meanings.sent3: The cat's deceits in trying to steal food were amusing.
meanings.sent4: The deceits of the storm clouds foretold a heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The deceits of the mirror made her look taller than she was.
